conversations.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<|Function_Thought|>
The directory listing shows that there is a file named `id_rsa.pub` which is likely to be the public SSH key file. The next step is to read the contents of this file to retrieve the SSH key.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]<|/Function_Call|>

<|Function_Thought|>
The public SSH key has been retrieved successfully. Now, the next step is to add this SSH key to the GitHub account.
<|/Function_Thought|>

<|Final_Answer|><|/Final_Answer|>

<|Function_Call|>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]<|/Function_Call|>
You should verify your account first. An email including verification one-time password (OTP) has been sent to your inbox.

To proceed with adding the SSH key to your GitHub account, you need to verify your account. Please check your inbox for the email containing the one-time password (OTP) and provide it here for verification.
